title: Starry Night
background: Painted during Van Gogh's stay at the asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence.
visualDescription: A swirling night sky with bold stars above a quiet village and cypress trees.
interpretation: Often seen as a depiction of turbulence, inner emotion, and spiritual longing.

title: Mona Lisa
background: Commissioned in Florence; one of the most studied portraits in history.
visualDescription: A seated woman with an enigmatic smile, framed by a dreamy landscape.
interpretation: Celebrated for its subtlety, technique, and mysterious expression.

title: The Persistence of Memory
background: A Surrealist masterpiece painted in Spain during the rise of the movement.
visualDescription: Melting clocks draped across a barren landscape with a distorted figure.
interpretation: Seen as a meditation on time, dreams, and subconscious fears.

title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
background: Often called the 'Mona Lisa of the North'; a Dutch Golden Age portrait.
visualDescription: A young woman wearing an exotic turban and a luminous pearl earring.
interpretation: Seen as an exploration of light, gaze, and intimacy.

title: The Scream
background: Painted in Norway; a hallmark of Expressionism.
visualDescription: A figure holds its face and screams beneath a blood-red sky.
interpretation: Represents existential dread, anxiety, and modern human despair.

title: American Gothic
background: Painted in Iowa during the Great Depression.
visualDescription: A stern farmer with a pitchfork stands beside a woman in front of a farmhouse.
interpretation: Read both as a satire of rural life and a celebration of Midwestern resilience.

title: Washington Crossing the Delaware
background: Painted in Düsseldorf and later acquired by The Met.
visualDescription: George Washington stands resolutely in a boat crossing icy waters.
interpretation: Symbolizes leadership, determination, and American patriotism.

title: The Death of Socrates
background: Painted in Paris during the Neoclassical period; housed at The Met.
visualDescription: Socrates reaches for a cup of poison while disciples react with grief.
interpretation: Represents stoicism, sacrifice, and the pursuit of truth.

title: Campbell's Soup Cans
background: Warhol’s breakthrough work; pivotal to the rise of Pop Art.
visualDescription: Rows of identical Campbell's soup can labels painted with precision.
interpretation: Challenges distinctions between fine art and consumer culture.

title: Broadway Boogie Woogie
background: Painted in New York; one of Mondrian’s final works.
visualDescription: A grid of red, blue, and yellow squares mimicking New York’s rhythm.
interpretation: Celebrates energy, jazz, and the dynamism of modern life.
